content: Ting-Hao 'Kenneth' Huang Ting-Hao 'Kenneth' Huang é»æºè±ª Associate Professor College of Information Sciences and Technology (IST) Pennsylvania State University (University Park) Visiting Professor Cornell Information Science (Ithaca) I create technologies that help users. Combining Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), I build interactive systems to help people achieve their creative and social goals in day-to-day activities. From June 2025 to summer 2026, I'm taking a sabbatical leave from Penn State to visit Cornell Information Science in Ithaca, NY. I have limited capacity for requests and am avoiding morning meetings (ET)---but if you're in Ithaca, come say hi! Office (Cornell): 275 Cornell Bowers CIS Office Hours (Cornell): Weekly on Thursday 2-5pm in my office. No appointment needed! Email: txh710@psu.edu Google Scholar Curriculum Vitae (CV) Twitter: @windx0303 Website: KennethHuang.cc ORCID iD: 0000-0001-7021-4627 News Sep 2025 Giving a talk at Cornell Information Science Colloquium. May 2025 Attending the In2Writing Workshop, as part of NAACL 2025. April 2025 Attending CHI 2025 in Yokohama, Japan. April 2025 My group is presenting two main conference papers, one LBW paper, and one workshop paper at CHI 2025. Our Red Note paper won the Best Paper Honorable Mention! April 2025 PSU Crowd-AI Lab PhD #3, Dr. Ting-Yao (Edward) Hsu, successfully defended his dissertation! April 2025 PSU Crowd-AI Lab PhD #1, Dr. Hua Shen, is starting a new faculty position at NYU Shanghai! April 2025 Invited talk at JHU's Center for Language and Speech Processing (CLSP). April 2025 Leading the organization of MASC-SLL 2025 at Penn State, with over 100 participants attending in person! March 2025 Receiving the Best Paper Award at the AAAI 2025 AI4Research workshop! March 2025 Invited talk at the CTO Data Science Speaker Series at Bloomberg in NYC. December 2024 Receiving a research grant from Sloan Foundation to foster scientific figure caption writing!
